snippet: A lawsuit claimed that Cephalon, a subsidiary of Teva Pharmaceuticals, had paid generic manufacturers to keep a cheaper version of a drug off the market.
abstract: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries announces settlement of $512 million over claims by drug wholesalers and other companies that subsidiary Cephalon paid generic manufacturers to keep their cheaper versions of drug off market; settlement, largest ever paid to direct purchasers of drugs, must be approved by judge.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit claimed that Cephalon, a subsidiary of Teva Pharmaceuticals, had paid generic manufacturers to keep a cheaper version of a drug off the market.

headline.main: Teva to Pay $512 Million to Settle Suit Over Delay of Sleep Disorder Drug
headline.print_headline: Teva to Pay $512 Million to Settle Suit Over Delay of Sleep Disorder Drug
